intro: Trianthema portulacastrum, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are often yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is a hardy, low-maintenance plant often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
